metadata.title: Systematic review on respiratory syncytial virus epidemiology in adults and the elderly in Latin America

abstract.original_text: Results: Eighteen studies were included. Percentages of RSV detection varied highly across included studies for adult subjects with respiratory infections (0% to 77.9%), influenza-like illness (1.0% to 16.4%) and community-acquired pneumonia (1.3% to 13.5%). Considerable percentages of hospitalization were reported for RSV-infected adults with influenza-like illness (40.9% and 69.9%) and community-acquired pneumonia (91.7%).

sentences.segment_text: Percentages of RSV detection varied highly across included studies for adult subjects with respiratory infections ( 0 % to 77.9 % ) ,
influenza-like illness ( 1.0 % to 16.4 % ) and community-acquired pneumonia ( 1.3 % to 13.5 % ) .
Considerable percentages of hospitalization were reported for RSV-infected adults with influenza-like illness ( 40.9 % and 69.9 % ) and community-acquired pneumonia ( 91.7 % ) .
